briefdescription.para: Creates a new credentials object.

simplesect.para: the new object or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Creates a new object with credentials (user ID and process ID) from the current process.

simplesect.para: the new object or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Increment refcount on credentials.
Decrement refcount on credentials.
Add a UNIX process ID to the credentials.
Add a UNIX user ID to the credentials.
Add a Windows user SID to the credentials.
Add ADT audit data to the credentials.
Checks whether the given credential is present.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the credential is present

briefdescription.para: Gets the UNIX process ID in the credentials, or DBUS_PID_UNSET if the credentials object doesn't contain a process ID.
Gets the UNIX user ID in the credentials, or DBUS_UID_UNSET if the credentials object doesn't contain a user ID.
Gets the Windows user SID in the credentials, or NULL if the credentials object doesn't contain a Windows user SID.
Gets the ADT audit data in the credentials, or NULL if the credentials object doesn't contain ADT audit data.
Gets the ADT audit data size in the credentials, or 0 if the credentials object doesn't contain ADT audit data.
Checks whether the first credentials object contains all the credentials found in the second credentials object.

parameterdescription.para: see if credentials in here are also in the first arg

simplesect.para: TRUE if second arg is contained in first

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a credentials object contains anything.

simplesect.para: TRUE if there are no credentials in the object

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a credentials object contains a user identity.

simplesect.para: TRUE if there are no user identities in the object

briefdescription.para: Merge all credentials found in the second object into the first object, overwriting the first object if there are any overlaps.
Merge the given credential found in the second object into the first object, overwriting the first object's value for that credential.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if the second object does not contain the specified credential. i.e., will never delete a credential from the first object.

briefdescription.para: Clear all credentials in the object.
Copy a credentials object.
Check whether the user-identifying credentials in two credentials objects are identical.

detaileddescription.para: Credentials that are not related to the user are ignored, but any kind of user ID credentials must be the same (UNIX user ID, Windows user SID, etc.) and present in both objects for the function to return TRUE.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the two credentials refer to the same user

briefdescription.para: Convert the credentials in this object to a human-readable string format, and append to the given string.
DBusCredentials object.

detaileddescription.para: Credentials are what you have to prove you have in order to authenticate. The main credentials right now are a unix user account, a Windows user account, or a UNIX process ID.
